questionTitle: English people are thought ________ less friendly than people from the Mediterranean.
Mary: Would you give this note to Mr Tomlinson, please? Ross: Sorry, I can't. He doesn't ________.
A few days after hitting his arm, he had a large black ________.
This is not the right ________ to ask for my help; I am far too busy even to listen!
I hadn't see George for years, but when I saw him in the street, I ________ him at once.
The cat was so frightened that it ran ________ the bed to hide.
He was unable to ________ his niece's wedding as he was ill.
She bought red shoes to ________ her red dress and handbag.
We'll have to ________ the meeting until next week because no one can come tomorrow.
I am not sure ________ the green coat is.
I don't think I'll beat him. I'm out of ________.
He is a very ________ person, but he has absolutely no sense of humour.
The school arranges a ________ to Brighton every year.
Beware ________ people who appear to be enthusiastic about your success.
If you fail ________ this attempt, don't count on me for help.
I separated them ________ each other because they were fighting.
I have to leave before seven and so ________.
There were no lifeboats on the ship because it was ________ to be unsinkable.
This church was ________ by the famous architect, Archbald Sparrow.
Jane is plain but her sister is very ________.
